jobs.description:
Job summary
NOTE: THIS POSITION REQUIRES RELOCATION TO LONDON, UNITED KINGDOM

The International Quality for Alexa team focuses on expanding Alexa’s capabilities on a global scale. We take on the unique challenge of understanding the nuances of how Alexa enabled devices can serve customers’ needs in different cultures and locations. If you are interested in shaping the future of Alexa for customers around the world, come and join our team.

The Role:

QA Engineers test code at the user level, both manually and with automated tools. Our QA Engineers use black box, gray box, and white box testing techniques; they are able to understand software internals, debug problems using log files, and write automated tests and/or user-level test automation tools. QA Engineers work with Software Development Engineers to understand features and technical implementation. QA Engineers also work with groups such as Product Management, User Experience Design, and Customer Support to understand customer usage models and develop test plans and test suites that approximate real-world environments and regression tests. QA Engineers are also responsible for driving the software development process toward quality-centric methodologies.


Responsibilities:
· Evaluate device functionality and create test strategies and test cases to assess device quality for multiple regions.
· Will work with a team of quality engineering professionals to ensure the highest quality product delivery against defined milestones
· Provide detailed status reports for a wide range of stakeholders
· Bug triage and defect tracking
· Test execution and automation
· Communication with a wide range of stakeholders (users, other technical teams and management) to collect requirements, evaluate alternatives and develop processes and/or tools as needed to support the organization.

jobs.description:
Job summary
At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our HR team as a Senior DEI Program Manager for France.
The Senior DEI Program Manager will be a results-oriented and resourceful leader who is capable of quickly taking control of their responsibilities and partner with our Business Leaders, DEI taskforce volunteer teams and Affinity Groups. The individual has demonstrated skills in the following areas: DEI leadership, program and project management focused on outcomes, data and situational analysis, cross group coordination across all levels of the organization, excellent oral and written communications.


Key job responsibilities
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

> Design and evolve Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) strategy for our French Corporate Organizations
· Design the France DEI roadmap identifying key pillars of the DEI strategy and translating them into relevant initiatives, in collaboration with Business Leaders, DEI taskforce teams, Affinity Groups and the Head of EU Consumer DEI.
· Build strong relationships with senior business leaders to develop a deep understanding of the business and increase awareness of DEI as a critical business imperative.
· Ensure consistency of actions across our local Affinity groups and our FR DEI taskforce volunteer teams as part of the broader DEI strategy and roadmap
· As a member to the European DEI Program Manager team, engage in pan-EU projects, benchmarks (both internally and externally) and in the identification, sharing and scaling of best practices.
· Act as DEI subject matter expert by contributing perspective, insights, and knowledge.
· Regularly measure and analyze DEI metrics (using both quantitative and qualitative data), highlighting areas of strength and opportunity.

> DEI Project Management, focused on outcomes
· Drive DEI program roadmap through project management, manage implementation activities, and develop processes, documentation and communications for rollout and ongoing support.
· Scale services and tools by designing processes and procedures that scale with the business growth.
· Define key performance indicators by developing metrics for core programs and processes, and track delivery against program objectives.
· Engage and influence cross-group stakeholders to deliver through others, understand blockers and build paths to green; escalade when necessary.
· Own DEI Quarterly Business Reviews, ad hoc reviews preparation and ensure relevant agenda, decision making and follow up.
· Communicate new/updated programs, policies, and processes to leaders, employees, stakeholder partners, and cross functional organizations.
